speaker: FALSTAFF
text: The Windsor bell hath struck twelve. The

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: minute draws on. Now, the hot-blooded gods assist

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: me! Remember, Jove, thou wast a bull for thy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Europa; love set on thy horns. O powerful love,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: that in some respects makes a beast a man, in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: some other a man a beast! You were also, Jupiter,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: a swan for the love of Leda. O omnipotent love,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: how near the god drew to the complexion of a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: goose! A fault done first in the form of a beast; O

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Jove, a beastly fault! And then another fault in the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: semblance of a fowl; think on ’t, Jove, a foul fault.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: When gods have hot backs, what shall poor men

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: do? For me, I am here a Windsor stag, and the fattest,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I think, i’ th’ forest. Send me a cool rut-time,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Jove, or who can blame me to piss my tallow?

speaker: FORD
text: Now, sir, who’s a cuckold now?

speaker: FORD
text: Master Brook, Falstaff’s a knave, a cuckoldly

speaker: FORD
text: knave. Here are his horns, Master Brook. And,

speaker: FORD
text: Master Brook, he hath enjoyed nothing of Ford’s

speaker: FORD
text: but his buck-basket, his cudgel, and twenty

speaker: FORD
text: pounds of money, which must be paid to Master

speaker: FORD
text: Brook. His horses are arrested for it, Master

speaker: FORD
text: Brook.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: Sir John, we have had ill luck. We

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: could never meet. I will never take you for my love

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              FORD
text: again, but I will always count you my deer.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I do begin to perceive that I am made an ass.

speaker: FORD
text: Ay, and an ox too. Both the proofs are extant.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: And these are not fairies. I was three or four

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: times in the thought they were not fairies; and yet

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the guiltiness of my mind, the sudden surprise of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: my powers, drove the grossness of the foppery into

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: a received belief, in despite of the teeth of all

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: rhyme and reason, that they were fairies. See now

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: how wit may be made a Jack-a-Lent when ’tis upon

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: ill employment.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Sir John Falstaff, serve Got and leave your

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: desires, and fairies will not pinse you.

speaker: FORD
text: Well said, Fairy Hugh.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: And leave you your jealousies too, I pray

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: you.

speaker: FORD
text: I will never mistrust my wife again till thou art

speaker: FORD
text: able to woo her in good English.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Have I laid my brain in the sun and dried it,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: that it wants matter to prevent so gross o’erreaching

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: as this? Am I ridden with a Welsh goat too?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Shall I have a coxcomb of frieze? ’Tis time I were

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: choked with a piece of toasted cheese.

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: Seese is not good to give putter. Your belly is

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: all putter.

text: “Seese” and “putter”? Have I lived to stand at

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the taunt of one that makes fritters of English?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: This is enough to be the decay of lust and late

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: walking through the realm.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Why, Sir John, do you think though we

speaker:

              PAGE
text: would have thrust virtue out of our hearts by the

              PAGE
text: head and shoulders, and have given ourselves

speaker:

              PAGE
text: without scruple to hell, that ever the devil could

speaker:

              PAGE
text: have made you our delight?

speaker: FORD
text: What, a hodge-pudding? A bag of flax?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: A puffed man?

speaker: PAGE
text: Old, cold, withered, and of intolerable entrails?

speaker: FORD
text: And one that is as slanderous as Satan?

speaker: PAGE
text: And as poor as Job?

speaker: FORD
text: And as wicked as his wife?

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: And given to fornications, and to taverns,

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: and sack, and wine, and metheglins, and to drinkings

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: and swearings and starings, pribbles and

speaker:
SIR
               
              HUGH
text: prabbles?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Well, I am your theme. You have the start of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: me. I am dejected. I am not able to answer the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Welsh flannel. Ignorance itself is a plummet o’er

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: me. Use me as you will.

speaker: FORD
text: Marry, sir, we’ll bring you to Windsor to one

speaker: FORD
text: Master Brook, that you have cozened of money,

speaker: FORD
text: to whom you should have been a pander. Over and

speaker: FORD
text: above that you have suffered, I think to repay that

speaker: FORD
text: money will be a biting affliction.

speaker: PAGE
text: Yet be cheerful, knight. Thou shalt eat a posset

speaker: PAGE
text: tonight at my house, where I will desire thee to

speaker: PAGE
text: laugh at my wife, that now laughs at thee. Tell her

speaker: PAGE
text: Master Slender hath married her daughter.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Doctors doubt that. If Anne

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Page be my daughter, she is, by this, Doctor Caius’

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: wife.

speaker: SLENDER
text: Whoa, ho, ho, Father Page!

speaker: PAGE
text: Son, how now! How now, son! Have you

speaker: PAGE
text: dispatched?

speaker: SLENDER
text: “Dispatched”? I’ll make the best in Gloucestershire

speaker: SLENDER
text: know on ’t. Would I were hanged, la, else!

speaker: PAGE
text: Of what, son?

speaker: SLENDER
text: I came yonder at Eton to marry Mistress

speaker: SLENDER
text: Anne Page, and she’s a great lubberly boy. If it had

speaker: SLENDER
text: not been i’ th’ church, I would have swinged him,

speaker: SLENDER
text: or he should have swinged me. If I did not think it

speaker: SLENDER
text: had been Anne Page, would I might never stir! And

speaker: SLENDER
text: ’tis a post-master’s boy.

speaker: PAGE
text: Upon my life, then, you took the wrong—

speaker: SLENDER
text: What need you tell me that? I think so, when

speaker: SLENDER
text: I took a boy for a girl. If I had been married to him,

speaker: SLENDER
text: for all he was in woman’s apparel, I would not

speaker: SLENDER
text: have had him.

speaker: PAGE
text: Why, this is your own folly. Did not I tell you

speaker: PAGE
text: how you should know my daughter by her

speaker: PAGE
text: garments?

speaker: SLENDER
text: I went to her in white, and cried “mum,”

speaker: SLENDER
text: and she cried “budget,” as Anne and I had appointed,

speaker: SLENDER
text: and yet it was not Anne, but a post-master’s

speaker: SLENDER
text: boy.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Good George, be not angry. I knew of

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: your purpose, turned my daughter into green,

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: and indeed she is now with the doctor at the deanery,

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: and there married.

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: Vere is Mistress Page? By gar, I am cozened!

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: I ha’ married un garçon, a boy; un paysan, by

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: gar, a boy. It is not Anne Page. By gar, I am

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: cozened.

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text: Why? Did you take her in green?

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: Ay, be gar, and ’tis a boy. Be gar, I’ll raise

speaker:
DOCTOR
               
              CAIUS
text: all Windsor.

speaker: FORD
text: This is strange. Who hath got the right Anne?

speaker: PAGE
text: My heart misgives me. Here comes Master Fenton.—

speaker: PAGE
text: How now, Master Fenton!

speaker: ANNE
text: Pardon, good father. Good my mother, pardon.

speaker: PAGE
text: Now, mistress, how chance you went not with

speaker: PAGE
text: Master Slender?

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text:
Why
               
              went
               
              you
               
              not
               
              with
               
              Master
               
              Doctor
              ,
               
              maid
              ?

speaker: FENTON
text:
You
               
              do
               
              amaze
               
              her
              .
               
              Hear
               
              the
               
              truth
               
              of
               
              it
              .

speaker: FENTON
text:
You
               
              would
               
              have
               
              married
               
              her
               
              most
               
              shamefully
              ,

speaker: FENTON
text:
Where
               
              there
               
              was
               
              no
               
              proportion
               
              held
               
              in
               
              love
              .

speaker: FENTON
text:
The
               
              truth
               
              is
              ,
               
              she
               
              and
               
              I
              ,
               
              long
               
              since
               
              contracted
              ,

speaker: FENTON
text:
Are
               
              now
               
              so
               
              sure
               
              that
               
              nothing
               
              can
               
              dissolve
               
              us
              .

speaker: FENTON
text:
Th’
               
              offense
               
              is
               
              holy
               
              that
               
              she
               
              hath
               
              committed
              ,

speaker: FENTON
text:
And
               
              this
               
              deceit
               
              loses
               
              the
               
              name
               
              of
               
              craft
              ,

speaker: FENTON
text:
Of
               
              disobedience
              ,
               
              or
               
              unduteous
               
              title
              ,

speaker: FENTON
text:
Since
               
              therein
               
              she
               
              doth
               
              evitate
               
              and
               
              shun

speaker: FENTON
text:
A
               
              thousand
               
              irreligious
               
              cursèd
               
              hours

speaker: FENTON
text:
Which
               
              forcèd
               
              marriage
               
              would
               
              have
               
              brought
               
              upon
               
              her
              .

speaker: FORD
text:
Stand
               
              not
               
              amazed
              .
               
              Here
               
              is
               
              no
               
              remedy
              .

speaker: FORD
text:
In
               
              love
               
              the
               
              heavens
               
              themselves
               
              do
               
              guide
               
              the
               
              state
              .

speaker: FORD
text:
Money
               
              buys
               
              lands
              ,
               
              and
               
              wives
               
              are
               
              sold
               
              by
               
              fate
              .

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I am glad, though you have ta’en a special

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: stand to strike at me, that your arrow hath

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: glanced.

speaker: PAGE
text:
Well
              ,
               
              what
               
              remedy
              ?
               
              Fenton
              ,
               
              heaven
               
              give
               
              thee
               
              joy
              .

speaker: PAGE
text:
What
               
              cannot
               
              be
               
              eschewed
               
              must
               
              be
               
              embraced
              .

speaker: FALSTAFF
text:
When
               
              night-dogs
               
              run
              ,
               
              all
               
              sorts
               
              of
               
              deer
               
              are
               
              chased
              .

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text:
Well
              ,
               
              I
               
              will
               
              muse
               
              no
               
              further
              .
              —
              Master
               
              Fenton
              ,

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text:
Heaven
               
              give
               
              you
               
              many
              ,
               
              many
               
              merry
               
              days
              .
              —

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text:
Good
               
              husband
              ,
               
              let
               
              us
               
              every
               
              one
               
              go
               
              home

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text:
And
               
              laugh
               
              this
               
              sport
               
              o’er
               
              by
               
              a
               
              country
               
              fire
              —

speaker:
MISTRESS
               
              PAGE
text:
Sir
               
              John
               
              and
               
              all
              .

speaker: FORD
text:
Let
               
              it
               
              be
               
              so
              ,
               
              Sir
               
              John
              .

speaker: FORD
text:
To
               
              Master
               
              Brook
               
              you
               
              yet
               
              shall
               
              hold
               
              your
               
              word
              ,

speaker: FORD
text:
For
               
              he
               
              tonight
               
              shall
               
              lie
               
              with
               
              Mistress
               
              Ford
              .
